name: 2-vinylbenzoic acid
Reason: 2-Vinylbenzoic acid has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene. The presence of two additional phenyl groups linked in a linear fashion raises the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
